intro: Phajus, commonly known as the golden groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features basal leaves that are lobed and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and often hairy. Phajus produces bright yellow flower heads that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open grasslands and rocky areas.
